title: Big oil must stop running scared and teach Extinction Rebellion some facts
text:
Oil companies are being held hostage by Extinction Rebellion. Instead of running away when confronted by climate change activists, it is time the industry’s top executives from companies such as BP, Shell and Total provided these campaigners with some hard economic facts about how oil markets work.

Teaching protesters who tried to shut down the annual Oil and Money forum held in London this week about the basic economic laws of supply and demand, which underpin global commodity markets, would be a good place to start.

Most importantly they need to dispel the myth that producers drive demand, because they don’t.
